question: Which country has the highest aggregate foreign funds in Swiss Banks, as per the Swiss National Bank (SNB)?
explanation:
As per the annual banking statistics released by the Swiss National Bank (SNB), the United Kingdom has the highest aggregate foreign funds parked with the Swiss banks. 
It is followed by the US and West Indies. The top-5 countries account for more than 50 per cent of the aggregate funds. India has moved down three places to 77th rank at the end of 2019, accounting for 0.06% of foreign funds. The funds parked by Indians fell by 5.8 per cent in 2019 to 899 million Swiss francs (Rs 6,625 crore).
